sen.j: 片山 久安（かたやま ひさやす、天正2年(1574年) - 慶安3年(1650年)）は、安土桃山時代から江戸時代初期の剣豪。
sen.e: Hisayasu KATAYAMA (1574 - 1650) was a great swordsman in Azuchi-momoyama era and early Edo era.

sen.j: 林崎甚助と並んで居合の達人とされる。
sen.e: He ranked as Iai (the Japanese martial art of using the Japanese sword, Iaido) master with Jinsuke HAYASHIZAKI.

sen.j: 林崎甚助の弟子とする説もあるが、片山伯耆流の伝承によると、伯父の松庵より秘剣を伝授された。
sen.e: There is a theory that he was an apprentice of Jinsuke HAYASHIZAKI, however, according to the tradition of Katayama-Hoki school, he received instruction of esoterica of sword from his uncle Shoan.

sen.j: 京都の愛宕神社 (京都市)で「貫」の一字の啓示を受け、流派を開いたと伝えられる（片山伯耆流の伝承では林崎甚助の名は出てこない）。
sen.e: He had a revelation of a letter "貫 " which means sticking to his principle in the Atago jinja Shrine in Kyoto City, then he founded his school. (The tradition of Katayama-Hoki school didn't mention anything about Jinsuke HAYASHIZAKI.)

sen.j: その後、豊臣秀次に招かれ武術を教え、慶長15年（1610年）、後陽成天皇の御前で「磯波」を演武して従五位下・伯耆守に叙されたと伝えられる。
sen.e: He was invited by Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI to teach martial art then he was said to confer Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and to be appointed as Hoki no kami (Provincial Governor of Hoki) in 1610 because of the martial art performance called "Isonami" in front of Emperor Goyozei.

sen.e: Hisataka served for the Kikkawa clan and the Katayama family had served for the Iwakuni Domain as one of the sword master families until abolition of feudal domains.
